trans-unit.source: Enable Microsoft Passport for Work in the organization | Microsoft Azure
trans-unit.target: Enable Microsoft Passport for Work in the organization | Microsoft Azure

trans-unit.source: Deployment instructions to enable Microsoft Passport in your organization.
trans-unit.target: Deployment instructions to enable Microsoft Passport in your organization.

trans-unit.source: Enable Microsoft Passport for work in the organization
trans-unit.target: Enable Microsoft Passport for work in the organization

trans-unit.source: After connecting Windows 10 domain joined devices with Azure AD do the following to enable Microsoft Passport for Work in the organization.
trans-unit.target: After connecting Windows 10 domain joined devices with Azure AD do the following to enable Microsoft Passport for Work in the organization.

trans-unit.source: Deploy System Center Configuration Manager version 1509 for Technical Preview
trans-unit.target: Deploy System Center Configuration Manager version 1509 for Technical Preview

trans-unit.source: To deploy user certificates based on Microsoft Passport keys, you need the following:
trans-unit.target: To deploy user certificates based on Microsoft Passport keys, you need the following:

trans-unit.source: **System Center Configuration Manager version 1509 for Technical Preview**.
trans-unit.target: **System Center Configuration Manager version 1509 for Technical Preview**.

trans-unit.source: For more information, see [Microsoft System Center Configuration Manager Technical Preview](https://technet.microsoft.com/library/dn965439.aspx#BKMK_TP3Update).
trans-unit.target: For more information, see [Microsoft System Center Configuration Manager Technical Preview](https://technet.microsoft.com/library/dn965439.aspx#BKMK_TP3Update).

trans-unit.source: and [System Center Configuration Manager Team Blog](http://blogs.technet.com/b/configmgrteam/archive/2015/09/23/now-available-update-for-system-center-config-manager-tp3.aspx).
trans-unit.target: and [System Center Configuration Manager Team Blog](http://blogs.technet.com/b/configmgrteam/archive/2015/09/23/now-available-update-for-system-center-config-manager-tp3.aspx).

trans-unit.source: **PKI infrastructure**: To enable Microsoft Passport for Work using user certificates you must have a PKI infrastructure in place.
trans-unit.target: **PKI infrastructure**: To enable Microsoft Passport for Work using user certificates you must have a PKI infrastructure in place.

trans-unit.source: If you don’t have one or you don’t want to use it for user certificates you can deploy a domain controllers (DC) of the new version of Windows Server:
trans-unit.target: If you don’t have one or you don’t want to use it for user certificates you can deploy a domain controllers (DC) of the new version of Windows Server:

trans-unit.source: **Deploy a DC of new version of Windows Server**: On a brand new Windows Server build 10551 or newer (The ISOs are available for download on [Signiant Media Exchange](https://datatransfer.microsoft.com/signiant_media_exchange/spring/main?sdkAccessible=true)) follow the steps to [install a replica DC in an existing domain](https://technet.microsoft.com/en-us/library/jj574134.aspx) or to [install a new Active Directory forest if creating a brand new environment](https://technet.microsoft.com/en-us/library/jj574134.aspx).
trans-unit.target: **Deploy a DC of new version of Windows Server**: On a brand new Windows Server build 10551 or newer (The ISOs are available for download on [Signiant Media Exchange](https://datatransfer.microsoft.com/signiant_media_exchange/spring/main?sdkAccessible=true)) follow the steps to [install a replica DC in an existing domain](https://technet.microsoft.com/en-us/library/jj574134.aspx) or to [install a new Active Directory forest if creating a brand new environment](https://technet.microsoft.com/en-us/library/jj574134.aspx).

trans-unit.source: Configure Microsoft Passport for work via Group Policy in Active Directory
trans-unit.target: Configure Microsoft Passport for work via Group Policy in Active Directory

trans-unit.source: You can use an Active Directory Group Policy to configure your Windows 10 domain joined devices to provision user Microsoft Passport credentials upon user logon to Windows:
trans-unit.target: You can use an Active Directory Group Policy to configure your Windows 10 domain joined devices to provision user Microsoft Passport credentials upon user logon to Windows:

trans-unit.source: Open Server Manager and navigate to **Tools** > **Group Policy Management**.
trans-unit.target: Open Server Manager and navigate to **Tools** > **Group Policy Management**.

trans-unit.source: From Group Policy Management, navigate to the domain node that corresponds to the domain in which you would like to enable Azure AD Join.
trans-unit.target: From Group Policy Management, navigate to the domain node that corresponds to the domain in which you would like to enable Azure AD Join.

trans-unit.source: Right-click **Group Policy Objects** and select **New**.
trans-unit.target: Right-click **Group Policy Objects** and select **New**.

trans-unit.source: Give your Group Policy object a name, for example, **Enable Microsoft Passport**.
trans-unit.target: Give your Group Policy object a name, for example, **Enable Microsoft Passport**.

trans-unit.source: Click **OK**.
trans-unit.target: Click **OK**.

trans-unit.source: Right-click on your new Group Policy object and then select **Edit**.
trans-unit.target: Right-click on your new Group Policy object and then select **Edit**.

trans-unit.source: Navigate to **Computer Configuration** > **Policies** > **Administrative Templates** > **Windows Components** > **Passport for Work**.
trans-unit.target: Navigate to **Computer Configuration** > **Policies** > **Administrative Templates** > **Windows Components** > **Passport for Work**.

trans-unit.source: Right-click **Enable Passport for Work** and then select **Edit**.
trans-unit.target: Right-click **Enable Passport for Work** and then select **Edit**.

trans-unit.source: Select the **Enabled** radio button and then click **Apply**.
trans-unit.target: Select the **Enabled** radio button and then click **Apply**.

trans-unit.source: Click **OK**.
trans-unit.target: Click **OK**.

trans-unit.source: You may now link the Group Policy object to a location of your choice.
trans-unit.target: You may now link the Group Policy object to a location of your choice.

trans-unit.source: To enable this policy for all of the domain joined Windows 10 devices at your organization, link the Group Policy to the domain.
trans-unit.target: To enable this policy for all of the domain joined Windows 10 devices at your organization, link the Group Policy to the domain.

trans-unit.source: For example:
trans-unit.target: For example:

trans-unit.source: A specific Organizational Unit (OU) in AD where Windows 10 domain-joined computers will be located.
trans-unit.target: A specific Organizational Unit (OU) in AD where Windows 10 domain-joined computers will be located.

trans-unit.source: A specific security group containing Windows 10 domain-joined computers that will be auto-registered with Azure AD.
trans-unit.target: A specific security group containing Windows 10 domain-joined computers that will be auto-registered with Azure AD.

trans-unit.source: Configure Microsoft Passport for work via deploying PowerShell through Configuration Manager
trans-unit.target: Configure Microsoft Passport for work via deploying PowerShell through Configuration Manager

trans-unit.source: Run the following PowerShell command:
trans-unit.target: Run the following PowerShell command:

trans-unit.source: Configure certificate profile to enroll "Passport for work" enrollment certificate in Configuration manager
trans-unit.target: Configure certificate profile to enroll "Passport for work" enrollment certificate in Configuration manager

trans-unit.source: To use Passport for Work Certificate based logon/Microsoft Hello, configure Certificate profile (Assets & Compliance -> Compliance Settings -> Company Resource Access -> Certificate Profiles) selecting a template that has Smart Card logon EKU.
trans-unit.target: To use Passport for Work Certificate based logon/Microsoft Hello, configure Certificate profile (Assets & Compliance -> Compliance Settings -> Company Resource Access -> Certificate Profiles) selecting a template that has Smart Card logon EKU.

trans-unit.source: Setup a scheduled task, which gets triggered when the Passport for Work container is enabled and requests Certificate evaluation
trans-unit.target: Setup a scheduled task, which gets triggered when the Passport for Work container is enabled and requests Certificate evaluation

trans-unit.source: This is a short term fix that admins need to create a scheduled task that listens for an Passport for Work container creation and requests certificate evaluation.
trans-unit.target: This is a short term fix that admins need to create a scheduled task that listens for an Passport for Work container creation and requests certificate evaluation.

trans-unit.source: This reduces the delay in setting up the container and PIN and its ability to be used on next logon.
trans-unit.target: This reduces the delay in setting up the container and PIN and its ability to be used on next logon.

trans-unit.source: To create the scheduled task, use the below command or use the UI
trans-unit.target: To create the scheduled task, use the below command or use the UI

trans-unit.source: schtasks /create /xml %0\..\<EnrollCertificate.xml> /tn
trans-unit.target: schtasks /create /xml %0\..\<EnrollCertificate.xml> /tn

trans-unit.source: The sample xml is as below:
trans-unit.target: The sample xml is as below:

trans-unit.source: Where the ScopeId_73F3BB5E-5EDC-4928-87BD-4E75EB4BBC34/ConfigurationPolicy_db89c51e-1d1b-4a17-8e42-a5459b742ccd is the ID for the certificate profile created in the step, "Configure certificate profile to enroll Passport for work enrollment certificate in Configuration manager" and <8> is the version.
trans-unit.target: Where the ScopeId_73F3BB5E-5EDC-4928-87BD-4E75EB4BBC34/ConfigurationPolicy_db89c51e-1d1b-4a17-8e42-a5459b742ccd is the ID for the certificate profile created in the step, "Configure certificate profile to enroll Passport for work enrollment certificate in Configuration manager" and <8> is the version.
